definition.featurexml: <xml xmlns="https://developers.google.com/blockly/xml"><block type="feature_container" deletable="false" x="40" y="40"><value name="feature"><block type="feature_huge_fungus"><field name="planted">FALSE</field><comment pinned="false" h="99" w="243">This block represent a crimson fungus, like the ones found in the Crimson Forest biome.This feature should be added during the VEGETAL_DECORATION stage</comment><value name="stem"><block type="mcitem_allblocks"><field name="value">CUSTOM:CorruptLog</field><comment pinned="false" h="80" w="160">This is the stem of the fungus</comment></block></value><value name="hat"><block type="mcitem_allblocks"><field name="value">CUSTOM:CorruptScale</field><comment pinned="false" h="80" w="160">This is the hat (or "leaves") of the fungus</comment></block></value><value name="decor"><block type="mcitem_allblocks"><field name="value">CUSTOM:CorruptBerryVine</field><comment pinned="false" h="80" w="160">This is the decorative block that can appear inside the fungus cap</comment></block></value><value name="ground"><block type="mcitem_allblocks"><field name="value">CUSTOM:CorruptNylium</field><comment pinned="false" h="80" w="160">This is the valid ground for the fungus. It cannot generate on other blocks</comment></block></value><value name="replaceable_blocks"><block type="block_predicate_matching_blocks"><field name="x">0</field><field name="y">0</field><field name="z">0</field><comment pinned="false" h="93" w="243">The fungus stem can replace any block that matches this condition. Here we check if the block to be replaced is in the "replaceable_by_trees" tag. This parameter is only used for versions 1.20 and above</comment><value name="blockSet"><block type="block_holderset_tag"><field name="tag">replaceable_by_trees</field></block></value></block></value></block></value><next><block type="placement_rarity"><field name="rarity">1</field><comment pinned="false" h="129" w="182">Placement modifiers are processed from top to bottom. If this condition isn't passed, the feature won't be placed</comment><next><block type="placement_count_on_every_layer"><comment pinned="false" h="101" w="207">This placement type works best for Nether biomes. We generate the huge fungus 8 times on each vertical layer, so that we have a proper forest at any height</comment><value name="count"><block type="int_provider_constant"><field name="value">10</field></block></value><next><block type="placement_biome_filter"><comment pinned="false" h="80" w="160">We add a biome filter, so that the fungi don't generate outside of the current biome</comment></block></next></block></next></block></next></block></xml>
